name: Deep Sea Headquarters
description: Premier deep sea fishing charter service with experienced captains and full-day trips.
longDescription: Deep Sea Headquarters has been sending boats out into the Gulf for decades, earning a reputation for knowledgeable captains and successful fishing trips. Their fleet ranges from party boats perfect for families to private charters for serious anglers. They target everything from red snapper to kingfish to marlin, depending on season and conditions.
address: 300 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Motion sickness? Take meds night before

name: Port Aransas Dolphin Watch
description: Family-friendly dolphin watching cruises through the Port Aransas channel.
longDescription: Port Aransas Dolphin Watch offers relaxing cruises through the ship channel and into the Gulf, where bottlenose dolphins are frequent visitors. The captains know where to find dolphin pods and provide entertaining commentary about local wildlife and history. It's perfect for families and those who prefer wildlife viewing to fishing.
address: 136 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: UT Marine Science Institute
description: University research facility with educational programs and visitor center.
longDescription: The University of Texas Marine Science Institute is a working research facility that welcomes visitors. Their education programs teach about Gulf marine life, coastal ecosystems, and ongoing research. Touch tanks, aquariums, and educational displays make science accessible and fun for all ages.
address: 750 Channel View Dr, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: The Tarpon Inn
description: Historic 1886 inn with walls covered in signed tarpon scales, including one from FDR.
longDescription: The Tarpon Inn is Port Aransas's most historic property, dating to 1886. The hotel is famous for its lobby walls covered with tarpon scales, each signed by the angler who caught it—a tradition dating over a century. Franklin D. Roosevelt's signed scale is among the collection. Even if you're not staying, the lobby is open to visitors.
address: 200 E Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Lydia Ann Lighthouse
description: Historic 1857 lighthouse on Harbor Island, viewable by boat.
longDescription: The Lydia Ann Lighthouse has been guiding ships since 1857, making it one of the oldest surviving lighthouses on the Texas coast. Located on Harbor Island, it's not accessible by land but can be viewed on dolphin cruises and boat tours. The lighthouse is still operational and remains an important maritime landmark.
address: Harbor Island, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: The Port Aransas Jetties
description: Iconic jetties for fishing, walking, and watching ships enter the channel.
longDescription: The Port Aransas Jetties are massive rock structures that protect the ship channel. They took 50 years to build (completed 1919) and extend into the Gulf, creating excellent fishing and walking areas. Watch massive cargo ships pass inches away, fish for redfish and trout, or simply enjoy the sea breeze. The south jetty is accessible by car; the north requires a ferry crossing.
address: 1000 S Jetty, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Pioneer RV Beach
description: Drive-on beach access point with parking and beach camping options.
longDescription: Pioneer RV Beach offers one of Port Aransas's drive-on beach access points, where you can park your vehicle right on the sand. It's popular for beach camping, fishing, and those who want to set up right at the water's edge. Daily and annual permits are available for beach driving.
address: Beach Access Road 1A, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Roberts Point Park
description: Waterfront park with pier, pavilions, and views of the ship channel.
longDescription: Roberts Point Park is Port Aransas's main waterfront park, offering stunning views of the ship channel, a fishing pier, picnic pavilions, and playgrounds. It's the perfect spot to watch ships, let kids play, or enjoy a waterfront picnic. The park hosts community events throughout the year.
address: 323 Tarpon St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Scarlet Lady Cruises
description: Sunset cruises and private boat charters for special occasions.
longDescription: Scarlet Lady Cruises offers romantic sunset cruises, private charters, and special occasion trips on beautiful vessels. Whether celebrating an anniversary, hosting a small wedding, or simply wanting an elegant evening on the water, they provide a memorable experience with personalized service.
address: 440 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Kayak Rentals
description: Kayak and paddleboard rentals with guided eco-tours through coastal waterways.
longDescription: Port Aransas Kayak Rentals provides kayaks, paddleboards, and guided eco-tours through the coastal marshes and bays. Their guides know the best spots for birdwatching, fishing, and wildlife viewing. Rentals include basic instruction, and they can deliver to your location.
address: 305 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Island Parasailing
description: Parasailing adventures with stunning aerial views of the coast.
longDescription: Island Parasailing takes you 500-800 feet above the Gulf for breathtaking aerial views of Port Aransas, Mustang Island, and the Texas coast. Single, tandem, and triple flights are available, making it perfect for families or couples. The experience is surprisingly peaceful once you're aloft.
address: 434 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Island Jet Ski Rentals
description: Jet ski rentals for thrilling rides through the bay and Gulf waters.
longDescription: Island Jet Ski Rentals puts you on powerful personal watercraft for exciting rides through the bay and Gulf. They provide safety instruction, required gear, and mapped routes for your adventure. Single and double jet skis are available, with hourly and half-day rates.
address: 410 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port A Golf Cart Rentals
description: Golf cart rentals for exploring Port Aransas in laid-back style.
longDescription: Port A Golf Cart Rentals provides the quintessential Port Aransas transportation experience. Golf carts are street legal on most Port A roads, making them perfect for cruising to restaurants, shops, and the beach. Daily and weekly rentals available, with delivery to your rental property.
address: 312 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Horace Caldwell Pier
description: Historic fishing pier extending into the Gulf with rod rentals and bait available.
longDescription: Horace Caldwell Pier is Port Aransas's main Gulf fishing pier, extending far enough to reach good fishing water. The pier house provides rod rentals, bait, tackle, and snacks, making it easy for anyone to fish. No boat? No problem—this is surf fishing at its most accessible. Catches include redfish, trout, and seasonal species.
address: 600 Tropic St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Coastal Bend Birding Tours
description: Expert-led birdwatching tours through coastal wetlands and Audubon sanctuaries.
longDescription: Coastal Bend Birding Tours offers guided excursions for birdwatchers of all levels. The Port Aransas area is a world-class birding destination, especially during spring and fall migration. Guides know where to find whooping cranes, roseate spoonbills, and hundreds of other species in local sanctuaries and wetlands.
address: 145 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Redfish Bay Charters
description: Inshore bay fishing charters targeting redfish, trout, and flounder.
longDescription: Redfish Bay Charters specializes in inshore fishing in the protected bays and flats around Port Aransas. These shallow-water trips target redfish, speckled trout, and flounder. It's a great option for those who prefer calmer waters, want a shorter trip, or are new to fishing.
address: 422 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Shelling Tours
description: Boat tours to San Jose Island for pristine shelling on uninhabited beaches.
longDescription: Port Aransas Shelling Tours takes you by boat to San Jose Island, a 21-mile stretch of uninhabited beach with some of the best shelling on the Texas coast. The undeveloped island means less competition for shells and pristine beaches. Tours include transportation and expert knowledge about shell identification.
address: 324 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Museum
description: Local history museum showcasing Port Aransas's maritime and fishing heritage.
longDescription: The Port Aransas Museum preserves and shares the rich history of this fishing village turned beach destination. Exhibits cover the tarpon fishing era, hurricane history, early settlers, and the evolution of the town. Photographs, artifacts, and personal stories bring Port A's past to life.
address: 101 W Avenue A, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port A Escape Room
description: Beach-themed escape room experiences for groups and families.
longDescription: Port A Escape Room offers immersive puzzle experiences with beach and pirate themes perfect for the location. Groups work together to solve puzzles, find clues, and escape within the time limit. It's a great rainy day activity or evening entertainment for families and groups.
address: 222 E Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port A Mini Golf
description: 18-hole mini golf course with beach themes and family fun.
longDescription: Port A Mini Golf provides classic family entertainment with an 18-hole course featuring beach and marine-themed obstacles. It's a fun activity for all ages, open day and evening. The course is well-maintained, and the beach theme fits perfectly with the vacation vibe.
address: 500 Cut Off Rd, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Ferry
description: Free 24-hour ferry connecting Port Aransas to Aransas Pass—an attraction itself.
longDescription: The Port Aransas Ferry isn't just transportation—it's an experience. This free, state-operated ferry runs 24 hours and carries vehicles and passengers across the ship channel. Dolphin sightings are common, and watching the ferry operation is fascinating. Most visitors ride it at least once, even if just for fun.
address: Ferry Landing, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Get out of car on deck

name: Island Sunset Cruises
description: Relaxing evening cruises showcasing spectacular Texas coast sunsets.
longDescription: Island Sunset Cruises provides the perfect end to a beach day—a relaxing boat ride as the sun paints the sky over the Gulf. These leisurely cruises offer BYOB options, dolphin watching, and photography opportunities as the sky transforms through golden hour. It's romantic, peaceful, and beautifully memorable.
address: 400 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Surf School
description: Surf lessons for all ages and skill levels with experienced instructors.
longDescription: Port Aransas Surf School teaches surfing to complete beginners and helps intermediate surfers improve their skills. The gentle Gulf waves are perfect for learning, and patient instructors ensure everyone stands up by the end of the lesson. All equipment is provided, and group and private lessons are available.
address: 200 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas SUP Tours
description: Stand-up paddleboard tours and lessons through calm bay waters.
longDescription: Port Aransas SUP Tours offers guided paddleboard excursions through the calm backwaters, marshes, and bays. Tours include instruction for beginners, all equipment, and knowledgeable guides who point out wildlife. Sunrise and sunset tours are particularly beautiful.
address: 315 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Leonabelle Turnbull Birding Center
description: Birding center with boardwalks through wetlands and wildlife viewing platforms.
longDescription: The Leonabelle Turnbull Birding Center is a must-visit for nature lovers. Boardwalks wind through wetland habitat, with viewing platforms overlooking ponds where birds, alligators, and other wildlife are regularly spotted. It's free, easily accessible, and one of the best birding spots in the area.
address: 1356 Ross Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Fishing Guides
description: Local fishing guides offering personalized inshore and offshore trips.
longDescription: Port Aransas Fishing Guides connects you with experienced local captains for personalized fishing experiences. Whether you want inshore flats fishing, bay trips, or offshore adventures, they match you with the right guide for your goals, skill level, and schedule.
address: Marina, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Beach Yoga
description: Morning yoga sessions on the beach with certified instructors.
longDescription: Port Aransas Beach Yoga offers serene morning yoga sessions right on the sand. Start your beach day with sun salutations, the sound of waves, and fresh Gulf breezes. Classes welcome all levels, from beginners to experienced practitioners. Mat rentals available.
address: Beach Access Road 1, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Dinner Cruises
description: Elegant dinner cruises with fresh seafood and sunset views.
longDescription: Port Aransas Dinner Cruises combines fine dining with an evening on the water. Enjoy freshly prepared seafood, quality wine, and spectacular sunset views as you cruise the bay and channel. It's perfect for anniversaries, proposals, or any special occasion deserving an unforgettable setting.
address: 440 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373
